Yes, our house is off the grid and all of the power comes from our 17kW solar array.  I built my own version of a giant powerwall from a battery salvaged from a wrecked model S Tesla which runs our house at night.

I married into this operation.  lol.  We are growing cattle on the farm my wife grew up on... where she helped her dad raise cattle (and tobacco).  He bought the farm in the 1960‚Äôs so I guess we are second generation.
I don‚Äôt watch TV channels at home either. We cut the cord in 2003.  All we have is Netflix and Amazon streaming.

I contend that the cattle on my farm, and in North America generally, are ‚Äúbovine flatulence neutral‚Äù since there were 40-60 million buffalo on this continent 200 years ago.

The past shutdowns occurred when Congress failed to appropriate (spend) the money, which is a different legislative activity than raising the debt limit.

Some people mistakenly think that not raising the debt limit would necessarily cause a gov‚Äôt shutdown.

Not true. 

When the gov‚Äôt reaches the debt limit, money spent must equal revenue collected.

The debt limit is a built-in balanced budget requirement that Congress overrides.

ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è 

Congress writes the checks.
